Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class ColorDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.ColorDetector
  • public class ColorDetector
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that has a reference to the colour light sensor to calibrate the initial colours and then detect which colours it is using the mean and standard deviation for initial colours
    Author:
    Xinyue Chen, Zheng Yu Cui, Alixe Delabrousse, David Kronish, Ariane Leroux
    See Also:
    Software Documentation for more details

    • Method Detail

      • DetectColor

        public static int DetectColor()
        Calculates the mean and standard deviation for the initial readings returns what the color is detected
        Returns:
        int where 0=red, 1=green, 2=blue, 3=yellow, and -1 for everything else

      • euclidean

        public static double euclidean​(double rN,
                               double gN,
                               double bN,
                               double rM,
                               double gM,
                               double bM)
        calculates the euclidean distance in RGB space
        Parameters:
        rN - normalized red reading
        gN - normalized green reading
        bN - normalized blue reading
        rM - mean red value for a color
        gM - mean green value for a color
        bM - mean blue value for a color
        Returns:
        the euclidean distance in double

      • rNormalize

        public static double rNormalize​(float r,
                                float g,
                                float b)
        this is used for normalizing the r value of a new reading
        Parameters:
        r - red reading
        g - green reading
        b - blue reading
        Returns:
        normalized reading

      • rCalibrate

        public static void rCalibrate()
        Calibrate the RGB values for the colour red. This is done just before starting the competition

        public static void gCalibrate()
